Simple Turkey Dressing with Cornbread

Jump to Recipe

If you’re looking for a delicious and comforting side dish to accompany your holiday turkey or chicken, this Simple Turkey Dressing with Cornbread is the perfect choice. Combining the sweetness of cornbread with savory ingredients like sautéed celery and onion, this dressing recipe is not only easy to prepare but also packed with flavor. Ideal for Thanksgiving or any family gathering, this dish brings warmth and satisfaction to your table. With just a handful of ingredients, including cornbread mix, chicken broth, and aromatic sage, you can create a delightful dressing that will have everyone coming back for seconds. Whether you're a seasoned cook or a beginner in the kitchen, this Simple Turkey Dressing is a must-try recipe that will elevate your holiday meal to new heights!

Ingredients

cornbread mix

If you don't have cornbread mix, you can make your own by combining cornmeal, flour, baking powder, sugar, and salt. Alternatively, use a package of stuffing mix for a different texture but a similar flavor.

chicken broth

For a richer flavor, consider using homemade chicken broth or low-sodium broth to control the salt level. Vegetable broth can be a great substitute if you're looking for a vegetarian option.

celery, chopped

Celery adds a nice crunch and flavor. If you don't have celery, you can use chopped carrots or bell peppers for a different but complementary taste.

onion, chopped

Onions provide sweetness and depth. Shallots or leeks can be used as substitutes for a milder flavor. Sauté them well to release their natural sweetness.

butter

Butter adds richness; you can substitute it with olive oil or coconut oil for a dairy-free option. Using flavored butters, like garlic or herb butter, can add an extra layer of flavor.

sage, dried

Dried sage is great, but if you have fresh sage, use it instead for a more vibrant flavor. Thyme or rosemary can also work well as substitutes if you're looking for a different herb.

salt

Adjust salt to taste, especially if using salted broth or butter. For a different flavor, consider using smoked salt or sea salt.

pepper

Freshly ground black pepper is always best for a more robust flavor. If you like heat, consider adding a pinch of cayenne pepper or red pepper flakes.

egg, beaten

The egg acts as a binder; if you need an egg substitute, you can use 1/4 cup of applesauce, mashed banana, or a flaxseed meal mixed with water for a vegan option.

Cooking Steps

  • Step 1: Preheat the Oven

    Start by preheating your oven to 350°F (175°C). This ensures that your dressing cooks evenly and achieves that perfect golden brown crust.

  • Step 2: Prepare Cornbread

    Using a package of cornbread mix, prepare according to the instructions on the package. Once baked, allow the cornbread to cool completely before crumbling it into pieces.

  • Step 3: Sauté Vegetables

    In a skillet, melt 1/4 cup of butter over medium heat. Add 1 cup of chopped celery and 1/2 cup of chopped onion. Sauté for about 5 minutes, or until the vegetables are soft and fragrant. This step adds a depth of flavor to your dressing.

  • Step 4: Combine Ingredients

    In a large mixing bowl, crumble the cooled cornbread. Add the sautéed vegetables, 2 cups of chicken broth, 1 teaspoon of dried sage, 1/2 teaspoon of salt, 1/4 teaspoon of pepper, and 1 beaten large egg. Mix everything together until well combined. Ensure the mixture is moist but not overly soggy.

  • Step 5: Transfer to Baking Dish

    Grease a baking dish with some butter or cooking spray, then pour the cornbread mixture into the dish, spreading it evenly.

  • Step 6: Bake

    Place the baking dish in the preheated oven and bake for about 30 minutes, or until the top is golden brown and a toothpick inserted in the center comes out clean.

  • Step 7: Serve

    Once baked, remove the dressing from the oven and let it cool for a few minutes. Serve warm as a delicious side dish alongside turkey or chicken.

Frequently Asked Questions

How do I prepare the cornbread mix?

Follow the instructions on the package of cornbread mix. Typically, you'll mix it with water or milk, and sometimes an egg, then bake it according to the specified time and temperature.

What should I do if I don't have chicken broth?

You can use vegetable broth or even water as a substitute. If you have bouillon cubes, dissolve them in hot water to create a broth.

How do I chop celery and onion properly?

For celery, rinse and cut off the ends, then slice it lengthwise and chop into small pieces. For onion, cut off the top and bottom, peel the skin, then slice it in half and chop into small pieces.

What is the best way to sauté vegetables?

Heat the butter in a skillet over medium heat until melted. Add your chopped vegetables and stir occasionally for about 5 minutes, or until they are soft and translucent.

Why do I need to let the cornbread cool before crumbling it?

Cooling the cornbread allows it to firm up, making it easier to crumble without becoming mushy.

How do I know when the dressing is done baking?

The dressing is ready when the top is golden brown and a toothpick inserted in the center comes out clean.

What can I serve with this turkey dressing?

This dressing pairs wonderfully with turkey, chicken, or even as a savory side to roasted vegetables.

Can I make this dressing ahead of time?

Yes! You can prepare the mixture ahead of time and store it in the fridge. Just bake it right before serving.

What if I don't have sage?

If you don't have sage, you can substitute with other herbs like thyme or poultry seasoning.

How can I ensure my dressing stays moist?

Make sure to add enough broth to the mixture. If it seems dry before baking, you can add a little more broth.

Additional Information

Dietary Considerations

For a gluten-free version, use a gluten-free cornbread mix. To make it dairy-free, substitute the butter with olive oil or a vegan butter alternative. The recipe can also be modified to be egg-free by using a flaxseed meal replacement. Always ensure that the chicken broth is labeled gluten-free and free from any animal products if catering to vegan preferences.

Pairings

This Simple Turkey Dressing with Cornbread pairs beautifully with roasted turkey, chicken, or pork. For beverages, consider serving it with a chilled white wine like Chardonnay or a light-bodied red like Pinot Noir. A refreshing apple cider or a tangy cranberry spritzer can also complement the flavors nicely.

Serving Suggestions

Serve the cornbread dressing warm in a beautiful casserole dish, garnished with fresh herbs like parsley or sage for a pop of color. Consider offering a side of homemade gravy or cranberry sauce to drizzle over the dressing for added flavor. For a rustic presentation, serve it on a wooden platter along with slices of turkey and seasonal vegetables, enhancing the festive atmosphere.

Simple Turkey Dressing with Cornbread

45 min
$10
180 kcal
Difficulty: 20%
Servings: 8

Allergens:

glutendairy

Dietary Tags:

vegetarian

Cuisine:

American

Course:

Side Dish

Tags:

easyquickholidayfamily-friendly

Description

A delightful and easy turkey dressing made with cornbread, perfect for any family meal or holiday gathering!

Ingredients

  • cornbread mix: 1 package
  • chicken broth: 2 cups
  • celery, chopped: 1 cup
  • onion, chopped: 1/2 cup
  • butter: 1/4 cup
  • sage, dried: 1 teaspoon
  • salt: 1/2 teaspoon
  • pepper: 1/4 teaspoon
  • egg, beaten: 1 large
